intro: Potentilla anserina var. bicolor, commonly known as the silverweed or white and yellow potentilla, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It features dense clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to yellow, blooming in late summer. The plant has silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or rocky habitats. This variety is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes used in garden landscaping.
